before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"45j6j","text":"Wipe bench surfaces with RNAse Away and keep working environment clean.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f6rjd","text":"Cost-efficient library generation by early barcoding has been central in propelling single-cell RNA sequencing. Here, we optimize and validate prime-seq, an early barcoding bulk RNA-seq method. We show that it performs equivalently to TruSeq, a standard bulk RNA-seq method, but is fourfold more cost-efficient due to almost 50-fold cheaper library costs. We also validate a direct RNA isolation step, show that intronic reads are derived from RNA, and compare cost-efficiencies of available protocols. We conclude that prime-seq is currently one of the best options to set up an early barcoding bulk RNA-seq protocol from which many labs would profit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cuok2","text":"prime-seq can be used on lysate or extracted RNA. It is essential, however, that the samples either have the same input or that they are normalized after the RNA is extracted, otherwise sequencing depth per sample will be impacted. Based on your starting material, please follow one of the following cases:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Lysate (similar input), Direct Lysis
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4drs3","text":"Follow this case if you are testing samples that have similar input (i.e. the expected RNA amount is the same between samples). The steps here will guide you in digesting residual proteins in your samples, extracting the RNA, digesting DNA, preparing RNA-seq libraries, and finally sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":53,"length":15,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3khbd","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19esn","text":"Example: investigating the genotype effect on transcription in 5,000 neurons","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Lysate (variable input)
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2tfn","text":"Follow this case if you are testing tissue that is of variable type or size (i.e. the RNA concentration between the samples will be different).
